Years ago, before Ahmed became a refugee in Beirut his father was killed by the Asaad forces. He lived on the streets in Lebanon for years, being abused by police. He's unable to read/write. And given all this, he's still one of the nicest, most generous people I met in Lebanon and that's why I'm making this request for help.
I met Ahmed when I first came to Lebanon in 2016. Beit Al Atlas was established as a safe home for people in our neighborhood inspired by the principle that “charity begins at home” - or the people closest to you deserve the most from you. Yourself, your family, your neighbors and further out. Ahmed certainly became a neighbor, and now I see him as a brother. 

Over the years Ahmed and I got closer, I remember him bringing whatever little food he had and cooking me Iftar in Ramadan and offering me a silver ring to be able to propose to Josephine, my wife. “Yallah Bilal, what’re you waiting for!” he would say. 
Over the years we tried so many ways to find him stable solutions while he was in Lebanon. I remember when we set him up with coffee equipment to sell coffee, but the police confiscated it, saying Syrians weren't allowed to work. 
As a refugee in Lebanon without proper papers he’s having a difficult time. He is not able to visit his daughter, wife and mother in Syria and he can’t integrate into Lebanon. 
This is why we are raising money to pay for Ahmed’s legal fees and establish his situation in Lebanon by also providing him a legal job at Cafe Al Atlas, the cafe that Saleh has founded on the first floor of Beit Al Atlas. Cafe Al Atlas is a startup cafe and needs some investment to become a destination in Beirut, sustaining both Ahmed’s and Saleh’s jobs. The strategy we’ve taken is to use Ahmed’s history planting figs and tomatoes on the rooftop of Beit Al Atlas and to turn Cafe Al Atlas into an oasis in Lebanon. We're reaching out for help to cover his legal fees, materials for the cafe, and the first few months of his salary. This will enable him to have a sustained job, and to be able to go back and forth to Syria more easily to spend time with his daughter, wife and mother, insha’allah all while creating a green fresh space for people in polluted Beirut AND supporting Saleh’s new initiative. It’s a win-win-win-win situation (fourth win is you ajr and joy for helping ;D!)

---

**Cafe Al Atlas: A New Beginning for Ahmed and the Community**

**Introduction:**
I'm Bilal, a friend of Ahmed, whom I met during my time at Beit Al Atlas. Witnessing his challenges as a Syrian refugee in Lebanon, I've been inspired to help him find a stable and legal livelihood. That's where Cafe Al Atlas comes into play – a startup café that not only aims to provide Ahmed with a job but also to become a cherished destination in Beirut.

**Campaign Goal:**
We are aiming to raise $8,000. This amount will cover Ahmed’s legal fees, necessary café materials, and his salary for the initial months, ensuring a steady start for both Ahmed and the café.

**Our Vision for Cafe Al Atlas:**
Located on the first floor of Beit Al Atlas, the café aspires to be more than just a coffee shop. It's a vision to create an oasis in the midst of Beirut's hustle, a place that brings the community together. Ahmed's experience in farming is key to our concept – we plan to integrate greenery and homegrown produce into the café, echoing his expertise in planting figs and tomatoes.

**How Your Contribution Helps:**
Your support will help us in multiple ways:
1. **Securing Ahmed's Livelihood**: Funding Ahmed's legal expenses and providing him a job at the café.
2. **Establishing the Café**: Investing in café infrastructure and initial operating costs.
3. **Creating a Community Space**: Aiding in the transformation of Cafe Al Atlas into a green, welcoming spot for all in Beirut.

**Ahmed's Journey:**
Ahmed's resilience despite hardships as a refugee without proper documentation has been nothing short of remarkable. From his days of struggling on the streets to his aspirations today, his journey is a testament to the human spirit. This café is a step towards giving him the stability and dignity he deserves.

**Join Us:**
We invite you to be a part of this journey. Whether you've known Ahmed, heard about Beit Al Atlas, or simply believe in our cause, your contribution will make a significant difference. Every donation not only supports Ahmed but also contributes to a larger vision of community and belonging.

**Thank You:**
Your generosity means more than just financial aid. It's a symbol of solidarity and a commitment to building a better world, one cup of coffee at a time. Visit us at Cafe Al Atlas in Hamra, where Ahmed, Saleh, and our team eagerly await to share our dream with you.

---
